content.text:
I want you to help me design and generate a full-featured mobile-first yet web friendly messaging , video calling, and hand, face, and finger annotations without one touching device to annotate.

It should be fully production-ready, App Store–viable, and deployed automatically to GitHub and Supabase after completion

I’m looking for specific, code-ready implementation steps using open-source tools with MIT or Apache 2.0 licenses only.

✅ App Overview:

A secure, real-time messaging app with rich media sharing and an advanced annotation system built with multiple edge ai's, a (t least 20 models for these uses)

🗨️ Messaging Features:

One-on-one and group chat

Real-time typing indicators, message reactions

Media sharing (images, videos, audio, PDFs)

Push notifications & offline support

🧠 Annotation System:

Multi-layered annotations (stackable UI layers for notes, highlights, audio comments)

Annotations are for gathering data for searches and tools

Designed like a modular pipeline

Touchless control gestures

🧾 Edge AI Capabilities:

detecting hands, face, geospatial data and user info by all available methods. pinchlikedetection in images/videos (e.g. scan frame and return matching product + price, length, distance, object, and the ability to do it at a car's pace 

✅ Implementation Requirements:

All technologies used must be MIT or Apache 2.0 licensed. I need you to:









Provide CI/CD pipeline 



Ensure App Store readiness:

Design and data storage policies

Offline behavior

Permissions and user privacy
admin and user sign up sign in, with verification

Okay, I understand your vision for a secure, real-time messaging app with advanced annotation capabilities and edge AI features. Here's a plan to get started:

**Features for the First Version:**

*   A secure login/signup flow with user verification.
*   One-on-one messaging with real-time typing indicators and message reactions.
*   Basic hand and face detection for touchless annotation control.

**Design Elements:**

*   **Colors:** Base color: White, Primary text color: Dark gray, Accent color: Blue, Highlight shades: Light blue.
*   **Typography:** Use a modern, clean font like "System" for a native feel.

**Next Steps:**

1.  Implement the user authentication flow using Expo's built-in authentication or a third-party library.
2.  Develop the one-on-one messaging screen with real-time updates.
3.  Integrate a basic hand and face detection library for initial annotation control.

Let's create an elegant and functional mobile app!

I'll help you build this comprehensive messaging app with AI-powered annotations! This is an ambitious project, so I'll start with a solid foundation and implement the core features step by step.

Let me first examine the current project structure and then implement the essential components.
Now I'll install the necessary dependencies for the messaging app with AI capabilities and implement the core features. Let me start by installing the required packages:

content.text:
✅ Included AI Functions (30+):

✅ Language translation (multi-way, contextual)

✅ Speech synthesis (TTS)

✅ Voice cloning

✅ 3D object & character modeling

✅ Pose estimation (real-time + in media)

✅ Hand, face, and finger gesture detection

✅ Object detection & classification

✅ Text summarization

✅ Text sentiment analysis

✅ Text-based question answering

✅ Image captioning + visual Q&A

✅ Background removal (images/video)

✅ Image editing (filters, object removal, correction)

✅ Style transfer (images, video)

✅ Video frame understanding (for AR overlays)

✅ Data visualization (charts from text or data input)

✅ Image-to-text and text-to-image generation

✅ Music generation

✅ Character animation

✅ Medical imaging analysis (X-rays, MRIs)

✅ Financial data analysis + forecasting

✅ Anomaly detection (user behavior, time series)

✅ Recommendation system

✅ Model benchmarking tools (for internal evaluation)

✅ Dataset creation (labeling, synthetic generation)

✅ Visual search (products, scenes, spatial detection)

✅ Help bot (NLP-driven assistant inside the app)

🧱 Architecture & Stack:

✅ All technologies used must be open-source (MIT/Apache 2.0). Your response must include:

📦 Frontend stack (mobile-first, cross-platform)

🧠 Edge AI model list, mapped to each feature

🗄️ Backend stack with Supabase, real-time DB, and user auth

☁️ CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions + Supabase deploy hooks

🔒 Privacy-first design — session storage, secure auth, opt-in AI

📡 Real-time sync & messaging (protocols, libraries)

🧰 Image, video, and 3D asset pipeline

💬 Voice + NLP stack for chat, help bot, and speech interfaces

🔍 Model benchmarking, selection, and model routing strategy

📱 App Store + Play Store readiness requirements

💡 Recommendations – Add These Missing Elements:

Please also include:

✨ AI Model Orchestration Layer (e.g., model routing, fallback)

🔁 Update System for Edge Models (on-device auto-updates)

🧑‍🎓 Onboarding Flow with Gesture Tutorial

🧪 A/B Testing Framework (for UI & AI features)

🧾 Audit logging for annotation and AI usage (privacy-safe)

🪪 Federated Identity Support (for enterprises, future SaaS)

🌍 Internationalization / multi-language UI

🧠 On-device fine-tuning or personalization of AI models

🔐 Secure analytics (anonymous, opt-in user event tracking)

🕵️‍♀️ Explainability layer for AI predictions (especially in sensitive use cases like medical, finance)

Okay, I will outline a design vision and implementation steps for your AI-powered mobile application, focusing on the newly requested AI functions and architectural elements.

Here's a breakdown of the features you want to add:

1.  **Comprehensive AI Functionality:** Integrating a suite of 30+ AI functions, including language translation, speech synthesis, object detection, and more.
2.  **Enhanced Architecture:** Implementing an AI Model Orchestration Layer, an update system for edge models, an onboarding flow with gesture tutorial, A/B testing, audit logging, federated identity support, internationalization, on-device fine-tuning, secure analytics, and an explainability layer for AI predictions.

Given the breadth of AI functionalities, the `app/(tabs)/ai.tsx` file will serve as a central hub. The `useAI.ts` hook will be expanded to manage and orchestrate these diverse AI models.

To address the need for an AI Model Orchestration Layer, consider using a routing mechanism within `useAI.ts`. This will allow you to dynamically select the appropriate AI model based on the task at hand, and implement fallback strategies if a model fails.

For the update system for edge models, you could explore using Expo's Over-the-Air (OTA) updates to push new model versions to the app.

I'll implement this comprehensive AI-powered mobile application with all the requested features. Let me start by reading the existing code structure and then implement the 30+ AI functions and enhanced architecture.
Now I'll install the necessary dependencies for the comprehensive AI functionality and then implement all the requested features.
